Class DayTradingSellingScreen

java.lang.Object
ui.DayTradingSellingScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
Screen
public class DayTradingSellingScreen extends Object implements Screen
The DayTradingSellingScreen class represents the user interface screen where users can sell shares in the day trading simulation mode.

Features include:

  • Animated vertical gradient background that smoothly changes colors
  • Stock-themed image overlay with translucency
  • Pill-shaped input bar for entering the number of shares to sell
  • Confirm and Exit buttons with hover scaling and shadow effects
  • Click-flash feedback effect on user interaction
  • Input validation for share amount (digits only, max 9 digits)
  • Integration with InvestmentSimulator for selling shares
  • Keyboard input handling including number keys, backspace, and escape

Usage notes:

  • Attach this screen to a DrawingSurface to integrate into the app's screen system
  • Use setup() to initialize fonts and load assets
  • Call draw() every frame to render UI
  • Call mousePressed() and keyPressed() for input handling

Version:
1.0
Author:

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Initializes fonts and loads background assets. Should be called once before drawing begins.
      Specified by:
      setup in interface Screen

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Draws the entire UI frame including background gradient, overlay image, input bar, buttons, status text, and click flash effect.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface Screen

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed()
      Handles mouse click events.
      • If Confirm button is clicked, attempts to sell the specified amount of shares.
      • If Exit button is clicked, switches back to the Day Trading main screen.
      Specified by:
      mousePressed in interface Screen

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed()
      Handles key press events.

      Accepts digits 0-9, backspace for editing the amount input, and Escape key to exit the selling screen.

      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface Screen

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased()
      No operation on key release.
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface Screen
